Module io.github.mmm.bean

Package io.github.mmm.bean

Provides the API for generic java beans defined as simple interface.

Bean API


Writing regular Java Beans is painful. You have to write a lot of boilerplate code and implement getters, setters, equals, hashCode, and toString.
The net.sf.mmm.bean.old.MagicBean API provided here saves you from all this pain and makes your life a lot easier. All you need to do is to write an interface for your beans that derive from net.sf.mmm.bean.old.MagicBean with property access methods. You can still define getters and setters if you like but there is no need to implement any method. For a complete list of features or an code example see net.sf.mmm.bean.old.MagicBean. In order to create instances of a custom net.sf.mmm.bean.old.MagicBean interface, you can simply use net.sf.mmm.bean.old.BeanFactory#create(Class). You may also add a static create() method in your net.sf.mmm.bean.old.MagicBean interface to make the usage as simple as possible.
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BeanClass
    BeanClass extends BeanType for a VirtualBean with extended information.
    BeanType
    A BeanType reflects a Bean (similar to a Java Class).
    ReadableBean
    Read interface of a Bean holding arbitrary properties.
    VirtualBean
    WritableBean that is virtual.
    WritableBean
    Writable interface of ReadableBean.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractBean
    Abstract base implementation of WritableBean.
    AdvancedBean
    Implementation of VirtualBean as regular java class.
    Bean
    Implementation of WritableBean for regular instances (that are not a BeanClass).
    DynamicBean
    A Bean that is always dynamic.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    AbstractBean.AddMode
    Enum with the available modes for adding a property internally.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Name
    Annotation to configure stable name or alias.
